content: all right friends and fellow crackers I hope you're ready for all this

and finish up Therese alright guys that start reading use a
dark green this is like an IV green but you can really use any dark green
there's my tree I've spray-painted that flat black and I've got a sponge a weft
a sponge and I'm going to use this with the dark green and just kind of Pat it
on stipple it on and that gives a really nice shading effect with the black in
the dark green there so then we'll finish up the tree and we'll be done
with that now I'm gonna use a lighter green and just use my sponge again yeah
I'm gonna stipple that on and see how it gives a really nice leaf effect there
without you really having to do much work so really like that finish up the
top and the bottom of the tree and we set with that now I'm going to use a
darker Brown and paint the branches inside the leaves inside the tree so get
all those that hot-glue detail we put in there right and I'm gonna use a tan and
kind of blend it in with the wet Brown and they'll give a nice variance in the
color of the branches almost like a painterly look they don't do the same
with the next layer now I need to do the trunks so I'm going to do this similar
type of thing I'm gonna use a wider brush of course and I'll go into the
trunk itself paint up that dark brown burr number Brown and once I get that
covered I'll use my lighter tan smaller brush
kind of put some that highlights on there kind of mix it into the to the

okay and here I have another tree and I'm gonna I've already painted Brown

still a little wet get a nice blend there really looks good you don't want
to totally blend it okay now I have more of a dirt brown right kind of a spicy
Brown and I'm gonna use this to do the base just dry brush the base with it you
want a different Brown than the trunk you don't want to blend into the trunk
then I'm going to use a my darker green again and I have those patches of grass
that I put on there with the with the shavings the pencil shavings right so
I'm going to kind of base those with this darker green I'm just using the
same one I used on the tree there we go nice and now if that's dry it I'm gonna
use this leafy green or it's a different lighter green than the one I use on the
tree I don't to use the same one so I'm gonna highlight that on the grass and
then do a little bit of highlight on the tree itself could be mosses stuff on the
tree so very nice yeah so now let's go to the table and check them out here we
have some miniature for scale and I think the trees came out really really
nice the layers are just really super playable you can put the miniatures on
them no problem if you have your Oriole creatures or creatures that can lurk in
trees just perfect for using miniatures you have to worry about dealing with

so pull it up I think the leaf texture looks really great really really nice I
got the bark texture from I've done this with other my other trees just looks
great we're gonna works perfectly I got the base with the grass and stuff on
there looks great and these are just really solid trees with the sand in the

when you put miniatures on them just came out really great super cheap and
easy to make so there we go there's our 2.5 D next trees I like to use these
clear storage bins to store my trees and a nice thing about these trees is they
